Data: Cummins to du Plessis, no run 138kph, full outside off, driven firmly straight to cover
Cummins to du Plessis, no run 138kph, good length on off, he's back and across and defending to point
Cummins to du Plessis, no run 138kph, good length on off, he defends from the crease to mid on
Cummins to du Plessis, no run 139kph bouncer, he tried to pull but half bailed out as it whizzed past his head, Maxwell yelled from point thinking there was a noise but no one else went up
Cummins to du Plessis, no run 139kph back of a length off stump line, he defends off the back foot into the off side
Cummins to du Plessis, no run 141kph, good length, off stump line, he defends from the crease with the full face of the bat
Stoinis to Markram, no run 125kph, good length on off, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
Stoinis to Markram, 2 runs 126kph, beautifully driven on the up wide of mid off, it wasn't a half-volley, but he controlled this and placed this nicely
Stoinis to Markram, no run 127kph, good length, he's back and across and defending from the crease
Stoinis to Markram, FOUR runs incredible shot working this with the wrists from a length of off stump wide of mid on and it races away with superb timing
Stoinis to Markram, no run shorter length angled to off, he turns this on the front foot to midwicket

Stoinis to Markram, SIX runs pulled over backward square again into the stands! Short ball at 124kph, he swivels again and just picks it up and lofts this with control and it carries all the way. You can't bowl there to Markram
Cummins to du Plessis, no run 138kph, good length, off stump line, he defends on the front foot back down the wicket
Cummins to du Plessis, no run 139kph, fourth stump line, perfect length, he defends on the front foot again to point
Cummins to du Plessis, no run 141kph, climbs off a length, he gets surprised by the bounce and gets a leading edge but it falls well short of cover
Cummins to du Plessis, 1 run 142kph, shorter length on leg stump, turns this away nicely through square leg
Cummins to Markram, 1 run 140kph, good length, angled into off, he turns with the angle through forward square leg
Cummins to du Plessis, no run 139kph, well wide of off, he's happy to leave, not quite short enough to cut
Stoinis to Markram, no run 125kph, back of a length middle and off, he defends on the back foot to midwicket

Stoinis to Markram, SIX runs another pull shot out of the ground! Too short again and this is a free pickings for Markram. He rocks back and smashes this up and over deep square and it flies over the fence, over the hill, over the back fence and down the street
Stoinis to Markram, 1 run 124kph, angled into leg stump, tucked easily off the pads to deep square leg
Stoinis to du Plessis, no run 124kph, back of a length, outside off, he defends on the back foot into the off side

Stoinis to du Plessis, FOUR runs skips down the track and lofts this back over the bowler's head! He predicted the length, skipped down to the pitch and lifted it up and over straight down the ground, didn't over hit it, it rolled easily to the rope
Stoinis to du Plessis, no run fuller length, on off, he defends on the front foot into the off side
Zampa to Markram, no run slides through, hits him on the pad big appeal but it was sliding down
Zampa to Markram, no run fuller on leg, he drives back to the bowler
Zampa to Markram, 1 run tossed up, driven inside out through cover-point to the sweeper
Zampa to du Plessis, no run 89kph, flighted leg break outside off, he pushes away to point
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run 88kph tossed up leg break, full, driven firmly to long off
Zampa to Markram, 1 run shorter outside off, cut very hard to Head at a closish point, he does well to knock it down but pinch one as it rolls behind him
Starc to Markram, no run wide half-volley angled across, big lash at a drive but misses
Starc to Markram, no run 138kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot to cover

Starc to Markram, OUT strangled down the leg side again! Unbelievable! This was a horrible delivery way down leg, a half-volley, he tried to flick it away and got a little tickle off the face and Carey takes another catch behind moving down the leg side.
Starc to Miller, no run 141kph, full tailing in a touch, on off stump, he defends on the front foot with the angle into the leg side

Starc to Miller, FOUR runs lofted up over cover! Wow. Some shot to get off the mark. This was full but not a half-volley, he check drives and lofts it up and over cover and times it magnificently. It fles to the rope
Starc to Miller, no run good length, wider of off, he leaves this one alone
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run tossed up leg break on off, 88kph, he drives to long off
Zampa to Miller, 1 run flatter on leg stump, he's back and working this through midwicket to the sweeper
Zampa to du Plessis, no run wider on the crease, leg break towards off, he defends on the front foot
Zampa to du Plessis, no run flipper skids through, he shapes to pull, it skids low, hits the pad, they appeal, not out. It was going down leg.
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run tossed up on middle, driven to long on
Zampa to Miller, no run looped leg break, pitched on leg, he stands up and defends from the crease
Starc to du Plessis, no run length at off stump, defended
Starc to du Plessis, no run ouch! Nasty blow for du Plessis as this jags up from back of a length. Leaps at him and takes the bottom glove and handle of the bat. He drops the bat to the ground
Starc to du Plessis, no run pushes a length delivery towards mid-on
Starc to du Plessis, no run touch fuller, he comes forward and drives into the covers
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run full and straight, neatly turned through midwicket with a flick of the bottom hand
Starc to Miller, no run a short ball, 142kph, at off stump and it's jabbed down into the off side
Zampa to du Plessis, no run full outside off, he drives and it skews off a thick edge to short third man
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run gets forward and drives down the ground to long-off
Zampa to Miller, 1 run full outside off, Miller brings out the slog sweep, goes all along the ground to deep square
Zampa to du Plessis, 2 runs full at the pads, tucked through square leg and they are alert to the chance of a second
Zampa to du Plessis, no run nice delivery, good length at middle, defended into midwicket
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run fuller, at the stumps, punched down the ground to long-on
Stoinis to du Plessis, no run full outside off, left alone
Stoinis to du Plessis, no run back of a length at off stump, he tries to shovel into the leg side but finds midwicket
Stoinis to du Plessis, FOUR runs aggression from the captain as he uses his feet and then drives with power through the covers, wide of the sweeper
Stoinis to du Plessis, no run length outside off, takes his bottom hand off the bat as he defends
Stoinis to du Plessis, 1 run down the pitch again, it'a a shorter ball this time and he pulls out to deep square
Stoinis to Miller, 2 runs works a length delivery off his pads behind square on the leg side, placed nicely
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run works a straight delivery into the leg side
Zampa to Miller, 2 runs short outside off, he rocks backs and carves it through the covers wide of the sweeper
Zampa to Miller, no run comes down the pitch, makes it into a very full delivery, drives to mid-off
Zampa to Miller, no run on the pads but Miller misses out as he flicks to square leg
Zampa to Miller, no run nice shape, good length at middle, straightens a touch and worked to midwicket
Zampa to Miller, no run a little flatter, on off stump, punched straight back down the pitch...decent stuff from Zampa
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run just wide of midwicket as he flicks a full delivery and doesn't quite keep it down
Hazlewood to Miller, no run pitches outside leg stump, takes the pad down the side, Carey cuts it off. The way Australia have go so far, maybe that line is a tactic
Hazlewood to Miller, no run good length at off stump, defended
Hazlewood to Miller, no run tries to come down the pitch, can only nudge a straight delivery back to the bowler
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run back of a length, worked off the stumps through midwicket
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run full outside off, nicely into a punchy drive which finds cover
Zampa to Miller, SIX runs he breaks the shackles with a big slog sweep, a fulll delivery on the stumps, Miller goes down on his back knee and connects sweetly
Zampa to Miller, no run pushed across flatter outside off, beats Miller's attempt to cut
Zampa to Miller, no run worked off the pads to square leg
Zampa to Miller, 1 run very full at the stumps, dug out into the off side
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run a full toss which is pushed down the ground to long-on
Zampa to Miller, 1 run another very full one, he drives hard into the ground and it bounces over cover to the right of mid-off
Hazlewood to Miller, no run full at off stump, 135kph, nicely forward into a drive which finds mid-off
Hazlewood to Miller, no run worked off the stumps to the on side
Hazlewood to Miller, no run back of a length, straight, no width for Miller to work with as he plays to the on side
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run pushes at a length delivery angled across, healthy outside edge down to third man...no slips in place
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run full outside off, du Plessis ponders an aggressive option for a second but then leaves it alone
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run this time there is aggression as he uses his feet again, drives on the up to deep point
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run round the wicket, full and straight, tapped to midwicket
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run tossed up with more air, tucked to midwicket and it's a scampered single...Miller brings out the dive, but it wasn't needed
Maxwell to Miller, no run full outside off, mistimes an attempted drive
Maxwell to Miller, no run gets some fortune here, plays back to a delivery which slides on and takes an inside edge past leg stump
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run driven past a diving Maxwell in his followthrough, down to long-off
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run nicely bowled, goes on straight from round the wicket, takes a leading edge towards point
Cummins to Miller, FOUR runs full and straight, lovely timing as he flicks it strongly through midwicket
Cummins to Miller, 1 run on leg stump, flicked off the pads to deep square
Cummins to du Plessis, no run good length outside off, defended
Cummins to du Plessis, FOUR runs top shot from du Plessis as he strides forward to delivery outside off, not a half volley, and drives wide of mid-off. Lovely way to bring up the hundred
Cummins to du Plessis, no run now he goes for a pull to a shorter delivery outside off, the ball scoots under the bottom edge
Cummins to du Plessis, no run short of a length, tight to off stump 135kph, pushed towards point
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run full outside off, driven to deep cover
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run works this from outside off to the leg side
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run uses his feet and pushes down the ground
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run full, pushed into middle and leg, driven into midwicket with a straight bat...brings up the fifty stand which was much-needed
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run pushed back to the bowler
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run dropped by Carey...du Plessis looking to play a shorter delivery through the off side, a thin nick which he can't glove. Could be a big moment
Cummins to Miller, no run back of a length at off stump, played with an open face to backward point
Cummins to Miller, no run short of a length, carries at waist height through to Carey
Cummins to Miller, no run a bouncer over middle, Miller ducks underneath
Cummins to Miller, no run another short one, Miller again allows it go over his back
Cummins to Miller, 2 runs that's a terrific shot, stands tall and punches off the back foot through the covers at the top of the bounce
Cummins to Miller, 1 run on middle and leg, worked off his pads down to long leg
Maxwell to Miller, no run nearly done in the air as he comes down the pitch, doesn't get to the ball, drives to the covers
Maxwell to Miller, no run leaves this alone outside off
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run full and straight, driven through the off side
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run goes on straight outside off from round the wicket, a leading edge into the off side
Maxwell to du Plessis, FOUR runs goes down on his back knee and sweeps this from outside off, hard square of the wicket. Good shot. That's how to play the fill-in bowler
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run and again, another sweep, this time goes behind square and straight to the man
Cummins to du Plessis, no run back of a length at off stump, 137kph, defended with a closed face to midwicket
Cummins to du Plessis, no run wild swing as du Plessis charges down the pitch and tries to hack a short-of-a-length delivery through the leg side
Cummins to du Plessis, 1 run stays in his crease this time, flicks a straight delivery to long leg
Cummins to Miller, no run a shorter delivery, Miller gets on his toes and defends it down by his feet
Cummins to Miller, FOUR runs driven over the off side, the second time he's done that, coming forward into the shot, doesn't keep it down but it's timed sweetly and just clears the infield
Cummins to Miller, no run a good short ball to end the over, he sways out of the line
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run stays round the wicket, pushed back to the bowler
Maxwell to du Plessis, 2 wide slips this well down the leg side, Carey palms it away so an extra run
Maxwell to Miller, no run slides on outside off, left alone
Maxwell to Miller, 2 runs touch shorter, he goes back and drives to deep cover
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run full and driven wide of cover
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run uses his feet, this is outside leg stump, knocked into midwicket as he nearly loses his balance
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run dragged from full outside off with a sweep, out to deep midwicket
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run back of a length on the pads, worked into midwicket
Starc to Miller, 1 run flicks a length delivery behind square on the leg side
Starc to du Plessis, no run full at off stump, a slower ball at 122kph, defended to the off side
Starc to du Plessis, 2 runs a short slower ball, du Plessis is almost through his pull and it loops down to long leg
Starc to du Plessis, 2 runs full, width outside off, driven towards cover who gets a hand on it with a drive, the throw from mid-off then cannons off the stumps for an extra run
Starc to du Plessis, no run that's a good-looking shot, driven on the up but straight to cover
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run angles the face and pushes into the covers
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run round the wicket, full and straight, nudged into the leg side
Maxwell to Miller, no run full at the stumps, driven to cover where Finch dives and saves

Maxwell to Miller, no run he's broken through! Been a good spell form Maxwell and he's pinned Miller lbw. Slides on from round the wicket. At the last moment they go for the review, du Plessis keen for it. Hits below the knee roll...well, well, I thought there may have been a small mark on Hot Spot but third umpire says not. But it's missing leg stump on the angle
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run very full, driven firmly to deep cover
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run taken from outside off into the leg side
Starc to Miller, 2 runs 134kph, back of a length, tucked behind square and they run really well to get a couple
Starc to Miller, no run 140kph, tailing into off, he works it with the angle straight to midwicket
Starc to Miller, no run 123kph slower ball, he tries to turn it to leg, gets a slight leading edge that rolls to cover
Starc to Miller, no run 124kph, shorter slower ball outside off, tries to cut hard but mis times into the off side
Starc to Miller, 2 runs mistimed pull top edge, just flies away from mid on! This was a good short ball, he top edges a pull and it loops just out of Finch's reach running back from mid on
Starc to Miller, no run cracking yorker, spearing into off, he digs this out well
Maxwell to du Plessis, FOUR runs cut away past point! Fractionally short and wide and he placed this nicely past backward point
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run looped up on leg, clipped out to deep midwicket
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run shorter length, punched off the back foot to deep cover
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run skips down the track and works with the spin to deep midwicket
Maxwell to Miller, no run looped up again, he's down the track, not quite there, works against the turn to midwicket
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run slightly shorter, he waits in the crease, knocks it in the gap at square leg
Stoinis to Miller, 1 run angled down leg, clipped nicely to fine leg
Stoinis to du Plessis, 1 run short outside off, cut hard to the sweeper at deep cover-point
Stoinis to Miller, FOUR runs short and cracks a pull shot to deep square! Great shot to bring up 50. That is two in a row. He was so quick to pull this away into the gap behind square
Stoinis to Miller, 1 run shorter again, he pulls hard but straight to the man at deep forward square
Stoinis to du Plessis, 1 run full outside off, driven nicely to long off. Fifty for Faf. His 30th in ODI cricket.
Stoinis to Miller, no run good length on off, he defends into the off side
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run edged closing the blade, it runs to short third man
Maxwell to Miller, 2 runs superb sweep shot, struck magnificently behind square, Marsh runs around and makes a great save on the rope
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run advances down the track and tries to loft, but drags it through midwicket
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run attempted sweep, it goes under the bat outside off and taken by the keeper
Maxwell to du Plessis, 2 runs clipped nicely into the gap at midwicket and they run very well
Maxwell to du Plessis, FOUR runs sweeps brilliantly behind square and it beats the sweeper! That was amazing placement to sweep it finer than the man on the rope
Stoinis to Miller, no run short ball, attempted pull, hits the body and flies up in the air but there was no bat and it landed safely
Stoinis to Miller, FOUR runs skips down and lofts it over mid off! Good batting. Mid off is up and he jumped down and lofted a length ball up and over the man in the ring
Stoinis to Miller, 2 runs slower ball, pitched short, he rolls the wrists and pulls hard into the gap behind square
Stoinis to Miller, 2 runs back of a length, cracked off the back foot wide of cover and the point sweeper has to come around to collect on the rope
Stoinis to Miller, 1 run short on the hip, pulled hard to deep square leg
Stoinis to du Plessis, FOUR runs the Dil scoop for four! Faf on fire. He was down early, ready to scoop ramp it from outside off to fine leg and the vacant rope
Hazlewood to Miller, no run short and wide and cut straight to backward point
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run short outside off, he punches hard off the back foot to deep point
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run 136kph, good length outside off, glided off the front foot down to third man
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run short ball into the body, 139kph, he pulls but mistimes around to deep fine leg
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run good length, 138kph, hits him on the thigh, half an appeal from Hazlewood but it is way too high
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run 137kph, top of off, he dabs this into the gully and they take an easy one
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run skips down to a leg break, he works against the turn through forward square
Zampa to Miller, no run short length, he punches off the back foot to cover
Zampa to Miller, SIX runs shuffles around the crease and launches a slog sweep over deep square into the Ricky Ponting stand!
Zampa to Miller, 1 run tossed up on off, driven hard to long off
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run gives room, yorker length, chops off the inside edge to short fine
Zampa to Miller, no run zipped through outside leg, he tries to slog sweep again but misses, it comes off pad and rolls away
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run good length, 142kph, pushes to mid on who is right on the circle and they take an easy one
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run short ball, 140kph, at the body, he pulls around to deep fine leg
Hazlewood to du Plessis, FOUR runs cracked wide of long off! Wow. He's down the track and smashing this on the up in the air wide of cover and it beats long off on the rope

Hazlewood to du Plessis, SIX runs skips down again and launches over midwicket! Faf making a statement. He advanced again, it was banged in shorter and he went with it, picking it up and lofting over the midwicket rope
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 2 runs driven inside out on the up, straight of deep cover-point and he calls two immediately off the bat
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run 141kph, yorker, speared into off, he has to jam down and defend
Cummins to Miller, 2 runs 133kph, short on middle, tucked behind square and they sprint two. Great running to bring up the 150 partnership. What an effort from these two
Cummins to Miller, 1 wide 132kph, bouncer and the square leg umpire calls it a wide on height and Paul Wilson stretches the arms out
Cummins to Miller, 1 run short on the hip, he turns this to deep midwicket
Cummins to du Plessis, 1 run 135kph, short of a length on off, he's deep in the crease, turning this through square leg
Cummins to Miller, 1 run pushed to cover and they take on Head, he shies at the bowlers but misses but Miller was well in
Cummins to du Plessis, 1 run back of a length, 136kph, run slowly off the face to short third man for an easy one
Cummins to Miller, 2 runs pulled wide of fine leg and they sprint back for a second, the throw is just a touch high and Miller is able to scamper back in time
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run full on off, 141kph, driven hard down the ground to long off
Hazlewood to Miller, 2 runs driven hard inside out past cover and it forces long off to run around to cut it off
Hazlewood to Miller, FOUR runs he charges and backs away to a short ball, upper cuts over short third man! He wasn't in control but it was a calculated slash up and over with no man back
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run punched off the back foot to deep point

Hazlewood to du Plessis, FOUR runs sliced inside out over cover! What a stroke. He opened up the front leg, it was full he cracked it off the middle of the blade and placed it to the cover rope. Such a good shot
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run full and straight, driven down to long on
Starc to du Plessis, no run short slower ball, sticks in the surface, he tries to pull but is through the shot and gets hit on the chest
Starc to du Plessis, no run skips down, backs away, slower ball, he gets a little nick as he swings hard but it bounces well short of the keeper

Starc to du Plessis, 1 run full toss, nearly waist high, it surprises Faf, he bunts it away into the off side, asks whether it's a no ball but the square leg umpire rightly says no. It was stump high only
Starc to Miller, 1 run yorker, dug out into the leg side
Starc to du Plessis, 2 runs slower ball, 126kph, short and wide, cut wide of third man and they run an easy two to Hazlewood on the rope
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run full toss, 143kph, he checks a drive to mid off and runs an easy one

Cummins to du Plessis, no run attempted Dil-scoop, he misses, it flies to the keeper, they appeal for caught behind. Not out. Australia reviews. They think he hit this. Nothing on hot spot. It looks like it hit the left thigh. Nothing on snicko. Not out is the call from the third umpire. Australia lose the review
Cummins to du Plessis, 1 run full toss, leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
Cummins to Miller, FOUR runs slower ball onto the pads and he flicks this past short fine leg ! Great placement. It was too straight from Cummins
Cummins to Miller, 1 run 139kph, short ball, he pulls but mistimes, it rolls out to deep square
Cummins to du Plessis, FOUR runs skips down and lofts up and over mid on in the circle! Great batting with the man up. He was down like a flash to the length and lifting it with the bottom hand
Cummins to du Plessis, FOUR runs short and wide and cut hard in front of deep point and it beats the man! What timing from Faf! He smoked that. He moves to 99.
Starc to Miller, 1 wide 124kph slower ball bouncer, called wide on height over the batsman's head
Starc to Miller, 1 run full on middle, driven hard in the air for a distance to long on

Starc to du Plessis, 1 run short ball, pulled easily to deep square! A century for the skipper! His 10th in ODI cricket. He punches the air and celebrates. He gets a great applause from the rooms. What a super innings
Starc to Miller, 1 wide short and fired way down the leg side
Starc to Miller, 1 run slower ball, full toss on leg, clipped away hard to deep forward square but straight to the man
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run yorker, dragged to mid on off the toe of the bat
Starc to Miller, 1 run shorter length on off, he drops it down into the off side
Starc to du Plessis, FOUR runs short ball, he backs away and slaps this, swats it straight down the ground to the sight screen! Amazing shot!
Cummins to Miller, FOUR runs short outside off, ramped up and over short third man! Brilliant way to bring up his 5th ODI hundred! His second against Australia. This has been a magnificent innings
Cummins to Miller, 1 run short down leg, he helps it around the corner to fine leg
Cummins to du Plessis, 1 run clears the front leg and slogs this along the ground to deep midwicket
Cummins to Miller, SIX runs launched over square leg onto the hill! Goodness. The crack of the bat. It was a half-volley on leg stump and he picked it up and it went miles!
Cummins to Miller, FOUR runs short into the ribs he pulls hard behind square and it beats fine leg!
Cummins to Miller, FOUR runs skips down, backs away, one one knee cracks this in front of point! Are you kidding! That another superb shot. He hit this so hard from one knee
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run yorker, driven to mid off on the circle
Starc to Miller, SIX runs launched up and over mid off and way over the rope! Supreme timing. He stood so still and the flow of the bat was sweet
Starc to Miller, 1 run back of a length, cracked to deep point
Starc to du Plessis, FOUR runs attempted yorker, becomes a half-volley, he smashes this straight of mid off and it flies to the fence with no one back on the rope straight
Starc to du Plessis, FOUR runs full toss, cracked just wide of midwicket, and it races away to the rope again! What placement and timing
Starc to du Plessis, FOUR runs short ball, pulled hard forward of square! Unbelievable striking from Faf
Stoinis to Miller, FOUR runs slower ball, he slices it up and over backward point and it rolls to the rope! 300 up!
Stoinis to Miller, 1 run yorker, leg stump, 129kph, he gets an inside edge, onto pad and it rolls away into the off side

Stoinis to du Plessis, SIX runs One handed over cover! That is shot of the day! This was a half volley, he cleared the left leg but it was wide and he just threw the bat at it with one hand and it cleared the rope!

Stoinis to du Plessis, OUT caught at deep cover-point! What a catch! It was a slower ball short and wide, it was almost above his head, he waits and lofts a swatted cut to the deep, Shaun Marsh runs in dives forward and takes a superb catch! The end of an outstanding innings from Faf de Plessis
Stoinis to Miller, FOUR runs slower ball, short again, he waits and slaps a pull shot hard behind square and he finds the rope! What placement and timing
Stoinis to Miller, 2 runs short slower ball again, cracked again to deep square and Head slides on the rope to make the save
Hazlewood to Klaasen, 1 run yorker length outside off, drilled down to long on
Hazlewood to Miller, FOUR runs half volley, on leg, flicked hard behind square! He has hammered anything on his pads. Superb shot again
Hazlewood to Miller, no run big swing and a miss! Finally a dot! It was back of a length across him

Hazlewood to Miller, OUT caught at deep midwicket! The carnage ends! It was a full toss in the hitting arc to go out of the park, he nailed it flat to deep midwicket, Finch caught it right on the rope, he tossed it up as he overbalanced, stepped outside the rope and the back in to complete a good catch.
Hazlewood to Klaasen, 1 bye good length, he backs away, misses trying to go inside out, it bounces over the stumps and they pinch one to the keeper as he shies and misses
Hazlewood to Pretorius, 1 run half volley outside off, he slices it hard along the deck to deep point

Innings break What an incredible display from South Africa. They scored 130 from the last 10 overs and 75 from the last five overs. It was all due to Faf du Plessis and David Miller. From 3 for 55, they set new South Africa record for partnerships in ODIs against Australia. Faf made his 10th ODI hundred. David Miller his fifth, and his highest ODI score. Huge task for Australia
Welcome back. Big chase for Australia. Finch and Lynn to open the batting. Dale Steyn will open the bowling. Bit of debate about David Miller's lbw review earlier today
Steyn to Lynn, 1 wide starts with one down the leg side, so it's a wide to get going
Steyn to Marsh, no run good length outside off, left alone
Steyn to Marsh, 1 run back of a length, straight, tucked into midwicket
Steyn to Finch, 1 wide another one down the leg side, by a long way
Steyn to Finch, 2 runs not quite the right line, angled into the pads, timed nicely through square leg
Steyn to Finch, 1 run good length, on middle, Finch uses his wrists to tuck it behind square
Steyn to Marsh, no run just back of a length, on middle and off, defended back down the pitch
Ngidi to Finch, no run short of a length outside off, 128kph, tucked into midwicket
Ngidi to Finch, no run back of a length, punched square of the wicket to point
Ngidi to Finch, no run good delivery, back of a length outside off, Finch feels for it away from his body as the ball holds its line off the seam
Ngidi to Finch, no run gets this a touch fuller, 133kph, defended into the covrs
Ngidi to Finch, no run defended on the move into the off side
Ngidi to Finch, 1 run flicks this away from off stump, wouldn't want to miss that, runs down to long leg
Steyn to Finch, no run back of a length at off stump, 141kph, defended towards mid-off
Steyn to Finch, no run this is a little fuller, 140kph, Finch gets onto the front foot and drives past Steyn
Steyn to Finch, FOUR runs gets across his crease and times this very nicely through midwicket, using the pace on the ball
Steyn to Finch, 2 runs and now there's nice timing through the off side, punched at the top of the bounce between cover and mid-off
Steyn to Finch, 1 run a shorter delivery outside off, driven into the covers and they spot the chance for a sharp single
Steyn to Marsh, FOUR runs that's a delightful shot, pitched up outside off, Marsh drives it elegantly straight of mid-off
Ngidi to Finch, no run good length outside off, hits the splice hard as Finch defends to cover
Ngidi to Head, FOUR runs edged, but wide of second slip, came round the wicket straightaway, in the channel outside off, draws Head forward and he's certainly not in control
Ngidi to Head, no run full at off stump, 135kph, defended to mid-off
Ngidi to Head, no run touch wider outside off, left alone
Ngidi to Head, no run lovely line and length, just outside off and angling back, Head leaves alone
Steyn to Marsh, 1 run works a short-of-a-length delivery off his hip through square leg
Steyn to Head, no run angled across on a good length outside off, left alone
Steyn to Head, no run short of a length at off stump, defended towards point
Steyn to Head, no run well bowled, this is fuller, Head's feet a little stuck and he gets an inside edge into his pads
Steyn to Head, no run short of a length outside off, 138kph, sweetly punched off the back foot to cover
Steyn to Head, no run fantastic fielding by the captain who is having a decent day, this cover drive was nailed by Head but du Plessis dived full length
Ngidi to Marsh, no run stays round the wicket, full outside off, driven towards mid-off where Rabada pulls off another terrific stop
Ngidi to Marsh, no run defended to the covers
Ngidi to Marsh, FOUR runs another good drive from Marsh, gets across the crease and takes this from outside off straight of mid-on
Ngidi to Marsh, FOUR runs crunched! This time he drives on the up, throwing everything into this shot and sends it rocketing through the covers
Ngidi to Marsh, no run good length outside off, left alone
Ngidi to Marsh, no run back of a length at off stump, 136kph, defended to the bowler
Steyn to Head, no run short of a length, played off the back foot into midwicket
Steyn to Head, no run on off stump, 130kph, short of a length and defended
Steyn to Head, 1 run neatly played, jumps back in the crease and works this short delivery off his hip to deep square
Steyn to Marsh, no run some late movement back in at Marsh who is a little caught in two minds whether to be back or forward, pushes into the covers
Steyn to Marsh, no run on the stumps, a touch fuller, pushed back down the pitch
Steyn to Marsh, 1 run a little tentative against this short-of-a-length delivery, takes an inside edge and bobbles behind him
Ngidi to Marsh, no run good length outside off, left alone
Ngidi to Marsh, no run back of a length, through to the keeper
Ngidi to Marsh, FOUR runs that's a cracking shot as he gets onto the front foot to a fuller delivery and pings a cover drive wide of mid-off
Ngidi to Marsh, no run tries to drive again, not as much width this time, not in as good a position and takes an inside edge into his pads
Ngidi to Marsh, no run another inside edge as he plays forward, defending at a length delivery
Ngidi to Marsh, no run fuller at off stump, pushed to mid-on
Rabada to Head, no run he's chasing away from his body trying to drive, Rabada starts by flinging one across well outside off
Rabada to Head, no run short of a length, jumps into a cross-batted stroke and gets a bottom edge into the crease
Rabada to Head, no run makes good connection driving off the back foot, du Plessis makes another good save
Rabada to Head, no run full outside off, left alone
Rabada to Head, no run gets forward and drives on the up into the covers, once again it's the captain who intercepts
Rabada to Head, no run back of a length outside off, left alone and Rabada starts with a maiden
Ngidi to Marsh, no run round the wicket, back of a length, driven to point
Ngidi to Marsh, no run fuller at off stump, 137kph, pushed to mid-on
Ngidi to Marsh, 1 run nicely into the drive as Ngidi goes full outside off, can't beat mid-off but far enough to his right to get the single
Ngidi to Head, no run full outside off, he gets forward and drives...another dot ball to Head
Ngidi to Head, 1 run a shorter delivery, he gets inside the line and flicks to deep square leg
Ngidi to Marsh, no run good delivery, nips back off the seam and bounces down off Marsh's leg into the crease...isn't too far from rolling back into the stumps
Rabada to Stoinis, no run back of a length at middle and off, defended
Rabada to Stoinis, no run fuller, at off stump, 136kph and pushed back to the bowler
Rabada to Stoinis, no run nips back off the seam from short of a length, rebounds off his thigh pad
Rabada to Stoinis, no run good delivery, on off stump, defended to point
Rabada to Stoinis, no run a touch shorter, he plays off the back foot and it's another maiden for Rabada
Steyn to Marsh, 1 run full outside off from over the wicket, pushed into the covers
Steyn to Stoinis, no run back of a length at off stump, defended
Steyn to Stoinis, no run fuller, at the stumps, a little caught on the crease but safely defended to mid-on
Steyn to Stoinis, no run good length at off stump, 136kph, defended to cover
Steyn to Stoinis, no run plays back to quite a full delivery, also right across his crease, worked into the leg side
Steyn to Stoinis, 1 run full and straight, whips across his front pad through square leg
Rabada to Stoinis, 2 runs back of a length, straight, tucked around the corner down to long leg
Rabada to Stoinis, 1 run across onto off stump, runs off an open face through backward point
Rabada to Marsh, 1 run good length outside off, pushed to deep cover
Rabada to Stoinis, no run gets squared up a touch by this one, back of a length at off stump
Rabada to Stoinis, no run a little fuller, outside off, 136kph and defended to mid-off
Rabada to Stoinis, no run a good short ball, at the ribs as Stoinis gets right across his crease, fended down to the leg side
Steyn to Marsh, no run back of a length outside off, 127kph, defended to the covers
Steyn to Marsh, 1 run full outside off, a powerful drive through the covers out to the sweeper
Steyn to Stoinis, no run short of a length outside off, played into the covers on the back foot
Steyn to Stoinis, no run back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
Steyn to Stoinis, no run full outside off, 139kph, defended to the covers
Steyn to Stoinis, no run back of a length outside off, played into the covers and not much happening for Australia against a very tight attack
Rabada to Marsh, no run full and straight, a sweetly-struck straight drive but right back at Rabada who gets low in his followthrough
Rabada to Marsh, no run a slower ball, on a good length outside off, the bottom hand comes off the bat
Rabada to Marsh, no run tight to middle and off, 135kph, defended to the off side
Rabada to Marsh, no run comes round the wicket, on a good length at off stump, defended to the off side ring
Rabada to Marsh, no run a shorter delivery which he nearly plays back onto the stumps, but it just bounces over the timber
Rabada to Marsh, no run back of a length outside off, played with an angled bat to point
Tahir to Stoinis, no run a low full toss to start with but it's punched straight to short midwicket
Tahir to Stoinis, no run good length outside off, defended coming forward
Tahir to Stoinis, 1 run very full at off stump, driven just wide of Tahir down to long-off...a few ironic cheers around the ground at the run
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run uses his feet and then drives firmly to long-off
Tahir to Stoinis, 1 run on the pads and worked through square leg
Tahir to Marsh, no run a googly, full and straight, pushed into the covers
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run starts short of a length at off stump, defended with a high left elbow to cover
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run fuller, at the pads, but he can't beat midwicket as he works it away
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run back of a length at off stump, carefully played back up the pitch
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run touch fuller at off stump, worked into the leg side and still can't get off strike
Pretorius to Stoinis, FOUR runs and now he breaks free, a full delivery at the stumps, lofted cleanly over wide mid-on
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run back of a length outside off, defended to cover
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run pushed through outside off, he pushes to the gap at point
Tahir to Stoinis, 1 leg bye wrong un, spins into the pad and runs down the leg side fine short fine
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run tossed up driven back to the bowler who misses it, it runs to long on
Tahir to Stoinis, FOUR runs lofts inside out, check drive with the spin up and over cover! This was well controlled lofted wide of long off, pitched just short of the rope
Tahir to Stoinis, no run leg break on off, defended back to the bowler
Tahir to Stoinis, no run wrong un, shorter, pushed towards long on but midwicket cuts it off
Pretorius to Marsh, no run short and wide, 126kph, he tries to cut but mistimes into the off side
Pretorius to Marsh, no run 126kph, good length, fourth stump, guided straight to backward point on the bounce
Pretorius to Marsh, 1 run 127kph, shorter length, tight to off, he late cuts to third man
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run 126kph, short of a length, wide of off, he defends on the back foot to point
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run good length, 126kph, wide of off, he's jumping back across outside off and defending with the full face
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run 124kph, good length wide of off, he square drives on the up straight to backward point
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run driven in the air with the spin towards long on but it's well short of the man on the rope
Tahir to Stoinis, no run wrong un, outside off, defended to cover
Tahir to Stoinis, 1 run wrong un, short on leg stump, clipped behind square to the sweeper
Tahir to Marsh, no run wrong un again, nudged to backward point, Stoinis was looking to run but was sent back
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run leg break on leg stump, clipped past midwicket to the sweeper but there's no second run
Tahir to Stoinis, 1 run lofted, inside out again over cover, the man at wide long off gets around to field on the bounce
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run 125kph, good length angled in to middle and off, he works this with the angle to midwicket
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run 124kph back of a length on off, he's back and working to midwicket
Pretorius to Stoinis, 1 run 128kph, shorter length on off, he's back and tucking this to the gap at square leg
Pretorius to Marsh, 1 run angled into off, he works it square with the angle past the umpire to the sweeper
Pretorius to Stoinis, FOUR runs short and wide, and hammers a cut past point! Just enough width, too short, and he picked the gap, the filed got a touch but not enough to stop it running away
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run good length on off, he drives on the up straight to cover
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run whipped with the turn to midwicket, du Plessis misfields and allows a single
Tahir to Stoinis, 1 run very full, squeezed out through square leg
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run shorter leg break, dropped close into the leg side and they run well to get one
Tahir to Stoinis, 1 run leg break, shorter and wider, he waits and cuts to the sweeper at deep point
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run shorter length, punched off the back foot to deep long on

Tahir to Stoinis, SIX runs whacked over deep midwicket! This was a dragged down half tracker, he was back quickly, set up for the pull and smashed it over the fence at midwicket onto the hill. That was freebie for Stoinis
Pretorius to Marsh, 1 run shorter length, on off, tucked just square of midwicket for a single
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run 126kph, short and wide, he tries to cut but misses it just skidded a touch low, just enough to get under the bat
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run cracked off the back foot straight to point who is inside the circle
Pretorius to Stoinis, 1 leg bye 128kph, back of a length on middle, he tried to whip and it hits the thigh, runs away square for an extra
Pretorius to Marsh, SIX runs picked up and dispatched onto the hill! Too short, he swivelled on it quickly and pulled this up and over backward square. Fifty partnership up.
Pretorius to Marsh, no run good length, fourth stump, knocks this with soft hands into the off side
Tahir to Stoinis, SIX runs launched over wide long on to the hill! What a strike. It was a wrong un tossed up outside off and he picked it, and just mowed it to the hill
Tahir to Stoinis, FOUR runs tossed up, he slog sweeps again to the midwicket rope! He got to one knee and smacked it flat to the vacant midwicket fence
Tahir to Stoinis, 1 run pushed through flatter outside off, he knocks it away to point
Tahir to Marsh, no run flatter on off, he tucks this straight to midwicket
Tahir to Marsh, no run slower wrong un, he's forward and defending to cover
Tahir to Marsh, no run attempted sweep, hit on the pad, big appeal from Tahir, not out. Clearly pitched outside leg. Faf ignores the pleas from Tahir for a review. Rightly so
Rabada to Stoinis, no run 133kph, good length outside off, he's back and across and defending
Rabada to Stoinis, 1 run angled into top of off, he tucks to the right of Klaasen at midwicket and they pinch a tight one. Marsh was well in after Klaasen fielded and shied at the striker's end
Rabada to Marsh, no run good length, tight to off, he defends from the crease
Rabada to Marsh, no run 134kph, good length fourth stump line, he nudges away to point
Rabada to Marsh, no run 137kph, full toss, it surprised Marsh, he tried to turn to leg and get a leading edge to cover

Rabada to Marsh, FOUR runs lofted up and over mid on! It wasn't a half-volley, he hit through the line, mistimed it a fraction but he got enough to fly over Tahir's head on the circle at mid on and it races away
Tahir to Stoinis, no run attempted sweep, hits the pad, huge appeal again, not out. Again hit well outside the line
Tahir to Stoinis, 1 run tossed up, driven hard to long on along the ground
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run looped up slower, he shuffles out and drives hard to long on with the turn
Tahir to Stoinis, 1 wide tossed up wide of off, it spins wide of the guideline and is called
Tahir to Stoinis, FOUR runs short and wide and cut neatly between backward point and short third man! Great placement and batsmanship
Tahir to Stoinis, SIX runs climbs into this, launching it over long on into the stands!Fifty for Stoinis. He points to his chest. He is in for this fight
Tahir to Stoinis, no run tossed up, leg break, he drives to cover
Rabada to Marsh, no run 137kph, good length, middle and off, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
Rabada to Marsh, 1 wide 125kph, pushed with the angle down the leg side
Rabada to Marsh, no run 125kph, slower ball, angled into leg stump, it tucks him up, hits the pad and drops down at his feet

Rabada to Marsh, SIX runs A magnificent front foot pull over midwicket! That's a way to reach fifty! This was hammered so hard. It was dropped short and he flat batted up on to the concourse. That's as hard as any ball struck today
Rabada to Marsh, no run 139kph, good length, he tries to drive on the up, mistimes and drags to mid on
Rabada to Marsh, 1 run fuller 140kph, driven straight of mid on and runs with the stroke
Rabada to Stoinis, 1 run short outside off, 137kph, he steps back and across and rides the bounce glancing it off the back foot to fine leg
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run 120kph, wide and it kicks off the length, it flew way over the bat and surprises Stoinis. de Kock took it above his head
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run 121kph, good length, this stays low he defends off the bottom of the bat
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run 121kph, good length, outside off, he's back and across and working to midwicket
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run 122kph, straighter to off, he works with the angle to midwicket from the stumps
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run 123kph, good length, he tries to force off the back foot but picks out cover
Pretorius to Stoinis, 1 run back of a length, off stump, he's back and across and clipping it through square to the sweeper
Markram to Stoinis, 1 run shorter on off, he's back and punching to long on
Markram to Marsh, 1 run flatter and pushed through, he's back given room and punching hard to deep cover

Markram to Stoinis, no run tries to sweep and given LBW! Stoinis reviews immediately. Did it pitch outside leg? He is coming from around the wicket. Not much turn. It pitched inline but he got a big inside edge! The decision is overturned
Markram to Stoinis, no run pushed through, he's back and punching straight to cover
Markram to Stoinis, no run flatter and shorter outside off, he cuts to backward point and Hendricks makes a good save
Markram to Stoinis, no run shorter on off, he punches straight to cover and Stoinis admonishes himself about not hitting the gap

Pretorius to Marsh, SIX runs another pick up pull into the stands! Fractionally short, he plays a cracking pull shot, it flies into the stands onto the concourse and a police officer takes a great catch, falling over a chair!
Pretorius to Marsh, 1 run good length, he's back and punching down to long on
Pretorius to Stoinis, 2 runs half-volley, outside off, he's back and across and flicking incredibly behind square but he can't beat the sweeper on the rope
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run short outside off, 123kph, a bit of extra bounce, he late cuts to short third man
Pretorius to Stoinis, SIX runs flicked up over the midwicket rope! This was a half-volley on middle and leg and he just clipped it up and over midwicket
Markram to Marsh, FOUR runs sweeps behind square! Bad ball. Full drifting down leg, and he sweeps easily past backward square
Markram to Marsh, 1 run shorter outside off, he's back and cracking this to deep cover-point
Markram to Carey, no run tossed up on off, he's forward and defending back to the bowler
Markram to Carey, 1 run drifting to leg stump, he tucks this square of midwicket
Markram to Marsh, 1 run drifting to leg, he clips this hard to wide long on, wants two immediately but Rabada fires a rocket from the fence to prevent it
Markram to Carey, no run pushed through shorter, he's back and forcing straight to cover
Pretorius to Marsh, 2 runs short on off, he
Pretorius to Marsh, 1 run 125kph, good length, into off, he runs this off the open face down to third man
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run 125kph, short on off, he's back and knocking this in front of square on the leg side
Pretorius to Marsh, no run 123kph, good length, off stump, he defends towards point
Pretorius to Marsh, no run 124kph, good length on off, he pushes on the front foot to cover

Pretorius to Marsh, 1 run shorter down leg, he tries to pull again but it hurries onto it, comes off the glove, bounces just short of a diving de Kock, it rolls away and Carey is quick to call a single
Markram to Marsh, 1 run pushed through on off, he's back and cutting into the gap for a single
Markram to Carey, 1 run tossed up, full toss, he drives along the ground to long on
Markram to Marsh, 1 run good length on off, he just pushes down to long on
Markram to Carey, 1 run driven along the ground to deep cover
Markram to Marsh, 1 run tossed up, driven along the ground down to long on
Ngidi to Marsh, 1 run 130kph, good length, dropped close on the off side, Carey has to hurry, he just beats Markram, who hit with the underarm. He was in by one foot! That was really tight
Ngidi to Carey, 1 run knocked to midwicket and again they try to pinch one, Klaasen had Marsh cold but he misfielded!
Ngidi to Marsh, 2 runs angled into leg, he clips this nicely behind square for an easy two
Ngidi to Marsh, 1 run 135kph, angled into the pads, he gets a thin edge onto pad and it rolls away square
Ngidi to Carey, 1 run driven powerfully on the up, glorious stroke but straight to deep cover point
Ngidi to Marsh, no run beaten by a beauty, good length, nipping away, he tried to run it to third man but misses
Steyn to Carey, no run extra bounce and takes the splice of the bat to the off side
Steyn to Carey, no run back of a length at off stump, angled bat finds backward point
Steyn to Carey, no run tight stuff, back of a length at middle, no width to work with, played back to the bowler
Steyn to Carey, SIX runs another one into the crowd as Steyn drops short, terrific pick up by Carey as he swivels on a pull
Steyn to Carey, no run back on a full length outside off, miscued to mid-on
Steyn to Carey, 1 run driven out to deep cover
Ngidi to Carey, 2 runs short of a length outside off, angled down fine of third man so it's a comfortable brace
Ngidi to Carey, no run a very tough chance as this is drilled back at Ngidi, who gets his right hand down to it. Got to say that saved a boundary. Came back so fast
Ngidi to Carey, 1 run back of a length at off stump, angled behind point to third man
Ngidi to Marsh, 1 run a good hand on this at cover, Hendricks diving to his right, as Marsh crunches a cover drive
Ngidi to Carey, 1 run a strong cut shot as he's offered a touch of width, but Rabada is very fast at third man and keeps them to a single
Ngidi to Marsh, SIX runs miles over the leg side again! He's on the march. Just back of a length outside off, he fetches it with a might swing and it's well back into the seats
Steyn to Carey, no run full and straight, 142kph, played into the on side
Steyn to Carey, 1 run full outside off, punched on the up to deep cover
Steyn to Marsh, 3 runs super piece of timing as he places this between cover and mid-off, but it's a good chase by du Plessis
Steyn to Carey, 1 run back of a length, angled to third man
Steyn to Marsh, no run on off stump, short of a length, can't beat backward point
Steyn to Marsh, 1 wide a short ball just down the leg side, Marsh doesn't connect with a pull and gets the wide call. So close to his hip
Steyn to Marsh, 1 run short of a length, a little cramped as he pulls this, perhaps didn't quite bounce as expected, sends it to deep square
Pretorius to Marsh, 1 run round the wicket, full and straight, clipped to deep square
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run drives a length ball wide of point
Pretorius to Marsh, 1 run angled into the pads again, worked along the ground to deep midwicket
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run a length delivery at the stumps, pushed to long-on
Pretorius to Marsh, 2 runs flicked from off stump into midwicket, doesn't go beyond the fielding circle but they get back for a second. Excellent running
Pretorius to Marsh, 1 run drags the length back, on off stump, tucked into midwicket. Decent over from Pretorius
Rabada to Marsh, no run over the wicket, short of a length on off stump, played to backward point
Rabada to Marsh, 1 run full outside leg stump, gets a tickle into the pads and it runs towards short fine leg
Rabada to Carey, no run a yorker outside leg stiump, 135kph, dug out to midwicket
Rabada to Carey, 1 run short outside leg, he backs away to the leg side and upper cuts towards third man and goes one bounce to the man
Rabada to Marsh, 1 run tucks a back-of-a-length delivery into square leg
Rabada to Carey, 1 run another short ball is ramped down to third man, again not too far from carrying all the way
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run round the wicket, back of a length at off stump, a front-foot pull to deep square
Pretorius to Marsh, 1 run angled into the pads, tucked behind square and that's good work in the deep
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run drives at a length delivery, opens the face and runs it to third man
Pretorius to Marsh, 1 run fuller at off stump, bunted down the ground to long-on
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run just back of a length, a heave to the leg side and there's not much timing...more swift work at deep square
Pretorius to Marsh, 1 run full outside off, gets forward and drives into the covers but can't beat the man on the edge of the circle. Marsh to 98
Tahir to Marsh, 2 runs there's his hundred, a brilliant innings from Marsh...drills this delivery just to the left of Tahir and long-on can't stop the second
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run uses his feet, Tahir saw him coming, dragged it slower and wider, manages to drive to deep cover
Tahir to Carey, 1 run dragged down shorter, gets a bottom edge on the pull and it runs to short fine leg
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run dragged from outside off, pulled down to long-on
Tahir to Carey, 1 run gives himself some room to the leg side then drives into the covers
Tahir to Marsh, FOUR runs power and placement from Marsh, stays in his crease to a full delivery, opens his stance and drills a skimming drive between cover and long-off
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run round the wicket, short of a length, shoveled to deep midwicket

Pretorius to Marsh, OUT taken at deep midwicket! Marsh can't beyond his ton. Massive, massive moment. That came down with snow on it. A short-of-a-length delivery, Marsh was aiming to clear the leg side again but could only send it high into the night sky. Klaasen had an age to think about the catch as it came, but held on securely
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run short, angled into the hip, pulled to deep square
Pretorius to Maxwell, FOUR runs what a way to get off the mark as he swivels on a pull, takes the ball from outside off to split long leg and deep square
Pretorius to Maxwell, 1 run full outside off, driven powerfully to the sweeper
Pretorius to Carey, 2 runs length at off stump, pushed down the ground and this will be the other aspect of Maxwell at the crease - superb running
Ngidi to Maxwell, 1 run backs away to the leg side, it's a slow ball outside off, heaved into midwicket
Ngidi to Carey, 1 run big full toss from round the wicket, pumped down to long-on
Ngidi to Maxwell, 1 run another big full toss, Maxwell moving all over the crease, the ball thuds into the top of his leg and rebounds away. There's an ask for lbw...far too high

Ngidi to Carey, 2 runs dropped at fine leg by Pretorius! Not an easy chance. A big top edge as Carey pulled at a slower ball. He never looked steady coming in and shelled it close to the ground. Had no base for the catch
Ngidi to Carey, 1 run gets the yorker in, straight, dug out down the ground

Ngidi to Maxwell, 1 wide oh, well, think that may be a harsh wide call. Maxwell backs miles outside leg, Ngidi bowled it wide outside off but it went over the marker the umpire uses. Yeah, tough call I reckon for the bowler
Ngidi to Maxwell, 1 run full outside off, carved to deep cover
Rabada to Maxwell, FOUR runs power from Maxwell, it just a fraction short outside off, fetched over midwicket with a stinging pull shot
Rabada to Maxwell, 1 run full and straight, good ball, driven into the off side
Rabada to Carey, 1 run round the wicket, low full toss, flicked to midwicket on the edge of the circle. Hits with the throw, they try to steal an extra run but it's not on
Rabada to Maxwell, 2 runs full toss outside leg, he's back away and drives to long-off. They do well to get two there
Rabada to Maxwell, no run ah, well bowled, defeats him with a slower ball, short of a length, and he's through his shot far too early

Rabada to Maxwell, no run they have called for a review here, Maxwell moved right across his stumps and it was a yorker heading to leg stump which glanced the boot as it went through to de Kock. Ah, it actually glanced the pad and is missing another set of stumps. But it's a dot ball
Steyn to Carey, 1 run back of a length, straight, hitting the pitch hard, played to the off side
Steyn to Maxwell, no run short outside off stump, tries to ramp it down to third man, defeated by the change of pace and it's not called wide
Steyn to Maxwell, FOUR runs gets this over the off side, Steyn stayed short, Maxwell moved to the leg side and cut this in the air over point
Steyn to Maxwell, no run short again, Maxwell almost throws himself off his feet as he swings to leg, doesn't make contact
Steyn to Maxwell, 1 run short of a length, a crunching pull through midwicket but just a single
Ngidi to Maxwell, 1 run excellent delivery, gets the yorker in at off stump, all Maxwell can do is squirt it to backward point
Ngidi to Cummins, no run full outside off, swing and miss, another valuable dot ball
Ngidi to Cummins, no run fantastic yorker, such skill, fired in just outside off stump and Cummins plays over it
Ngidi to Cummins, no run another yorker on target outside off, he can't make contact, and this is brilliant from Ngidi
Ngidi to Cummins, no run swing and miss outside off, another full one, maybe not quite the yorker this time...four dots in a row
Ngidi to Cummins, no run fresh air again as Cummins misses his fifth in a row, that was probably there to drive, wasn't quite yorker length but superb stuff from Ngidi
Rabada to Maxwell, 1 run short, huge swing to the leg side, flies off the top edge towards third man and he loses the strike again
Rabada to Cummins, 1 run low full toss, straight, he gets bat on it to big cheers
Rabada to Maxwell, 2 runs gets the leg-stump yorker, it's a sweetly-struck drive in response, and they get a couple as cover cuts it off

Rabada to Maxwell, 2 runs moves over the off side, picks up a length delivery and pulls towards fine leg, a very good tumbling save on the boundary from Ngidi. His knee caught in the turf which is worrying, hope he's okay
Rabada to Maxwell, 1 wide follows him with a short ball as he moves to the leg side, it's too short
Rabada to Maxwell, no run beaten this time, gives himself too much to the leg side, Rabada keeps it full outside off
Rabada to Maxwell, 1 run a low full toss, he actually stands still this time and pushes down the ground to keep the strike

Ngidi to Maxwell, 2 runs just evades Hendricks in the deep, Maxwell heaved a length ball towards wide long-on. The fielder couldn't quite get there, but does an excellent job to recover and prevent the boundary
Ngidi to Maxwell, 1 run carved out to deep cover
Ngidi to Cummins, 1 run full outside off, drives firmly but straight to mid-off inside the circle
Ngidi to Maxwell, 2 runs this could be costly, a big full toss which he manages to pull between deep square and long leg...well fielded, Maxwell asks about the no-ball, but the umpires say it's okay
Ngidi to Maxwell, 1 run another pinpoint yorker, on off stump, jabbed into the off side
Ngidi to Cummins, FOUR runs misses the yorker this time, it's a full delivery at the stumps, Cummins is able to get underneath it and club wide of long-on
Steyn to Maxwell, 2 runs a cross-seamer from Steyn, full outside off, carved over mid-off without timing it cleanly
Steyn to Maxwell, no run backs to leg and has a swing and a miss to a short delivery
Steyn to Cummins, no run beats him a short ball as Cummins pulls
Steyn to Cummins, no run another short one outside off, Cummins can't connect. Lot of effort in this innings without much reward
Steyn to Cummins, no run another dot ball, 141kph, short of a length and he's through the shot too early (despite the pace)
Rabada to Zampa, no run backs away to leg, short of a length, and has a swing and a miss
Rabada to Zampa, no run full, straight, can only jab it back to the bowler
Rabada to Cummins, 1 run low full toss which he whips to midwicket
Rabada to Hazlewood, 1 wide a short ball outside leg stump, goes over his back and it's called wide...a few smiles around
Rabada to Hazlewood, no run and quite aptly it's a yorker to finish, dug out to the covers

So the series win to South Africa and they deserved it. A few things for Australia to take with them in their rebuilding, but they have a distance to go in one-day cricket. They won't play 50 overs again until January against India as they switch back to T20 mode before the Tests. There is a one-off T20 between these two sides on Saturday and we'll be back to bring you the acti
We'll bring you the presentation shortly...

South Africa win by 40 runs and take the series 2-1. A very fine performance today, highlighted by that huge stand between Faf du Plessis and David Miller then some outstanding death bowling. Dale Steyn to the fore again. Australia threatened for a while through Shaun Marsh's hundred and some strong hitting by Marcus Stoinis, but their poor start had left them a lot to do.
South Africa won by 40 runs
Player of the match is David Miller, SA
